results.title: Comparative cardioprotective effects of carvedilol versus atenolol in a rat model of cardiorenal syndrome type 4.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Carvedilol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077261 @@@Carvedilol@@@ was more effective than @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ in improving kidney functions, decreasing elevated blood pressures, attenuating @DISEASE_Cardiomegaly @DISEASE_MESH:D006332 @@@cardiac hypertrophy@@@, reducing serum @GENE_NPPB @GENE_25105 @@@brain natriuretic peptide@@@, and diminished @<m>DISEASE_Neoplasms_Fibrous_Tissue</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D018218 @@@cardiac fibrous tissue deposition@@@.

citations.NLM: Mohamed RMSM, Elshazly SM, Nafea OE, Abd El Motteleb DM. Comparative cardioprotective effects of carvedilol versus atenolol in a rat model of cardiorenal syndrome type 4. Naunyn Schmiedebergs Arch Pharmacol. 2021 Oct;394(10):2117-2128. PMID: 34398250
